diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Severe hyperosmolar metabolic acidosis due to large dose of intravenous lorazepam
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient exhibited acute respiratory failure following Escherichia coli sepsis and pneumonia, with significant metabolic acidosis indicated by lab results: pH of 6.9, bicarbonate level of 6.2 mmol per liter, an anion gap of 17.8 mmol per liter. The high serum osmolality of 462 mOsm per liter with an osmolal gap of 165 mOsm per liter and the significant dosage of intravenous lorazepam over 78 hours (1696 mg) were crucial factors leading to the diagnosis. Treatment included hemodialysis, with subsequent improvement in lab values.
